intro: Spermacoce prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically spreads along the ground, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Spermacoce prostrata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas. Its botanical features make it a common weed in many parts of the world.
